cell.html: A composer and writer best known for his song Bananas In Pyjamas . Blyton contracted polio in 1947 and learned to play the piano during his two-year convalescence to “demonstrate that the illness wouldn't get the better of him.” [48]
cell.text: A composer and writer best known for his song Bananas In Pyjamas . Blyton contracted polio in 1947 and learned to play the piano during his two-year convalescence to “demonstrate that the illness wouldn't get the better of him.” [48]

cell.html: A jazz singer who performed with her sisters as "The Boswell Sisters ". She caught polio, aged three, and was left with partially paralysed legs. Boswell used a wheelchair for most of her life. [49]
cell.text: A jazz singer who performed with her sisters as "The Boswell Sisters ". She caught polio, aged three, and was left with partially paralysed legs. Boswell used a wheelchair for most of her life. [49]

cell.html: As a child, singer-songwriter Judy Collins spent several months in hospital recovering from bout with polio. Collins later became a representative for UNICEF and has worked to promote polio vaccination programmes. [50]
cell.text: As a child, singer-songwriter Judy Collins spent several months in hospital recovering from bout with polio. Collins later became a representative for UNICEF and has worked to promote polio vaccination programmes. [50]

cell.html: A blues guitarist and singer. After a bout with polio at age nine crippled his hands Davis learned to play the guitar upside down, using a butter knife to help fret the strings, producing a similar sound to a slide guitar . [51]
cell.text: A blues guitarist and singer. After a bout with polio at age nine crippled his hands Davis learned to play the guitar upside down, using a butter knife to help fret the strings, producing a similar sound to a slide guitar . [51]

cell.html: Conductor James DePreist contracted polio in 1962 while on tour in Bangkok . Instead of using crutches and braces he conducts sitting down. [52]
cell.text: Conductor James DePreist contracted polio in 1962 while on tour in Bangkok . Instead of using crutches and braces he conducts sitting down. [52]

cell.html: Folk singer-songwriter and guitarist Donovan contracted polio, aged four, from the vaccine he was given. This left him with a limp and feeling excluded. However, he says "I kind of look back on it and think it was positive for me because it made me withdraw from my pals and realise I was different." [53]
cell.text: Folk singer-songwriter and guitarist Donovan contracted polio, aged four, from the vaccine he was given. This left him with a limp and feeling excluded. However, he says "I kind of look back on it and think it was positive for me because it made me withdraw from my pals and realise I was different." [53]

cell.html: A rock and roll singer and songwriter, leader of the band "Ian Dury and the Blockheads". His hand and leg were left shrivelled by a bout with polio at age seven. He has campaigned with UNICEF to eradicate polio. [54]
cell.text: A rock and roll singer and songwriter, leader of the band "Ian Dury and the Blockheads". His hand and leg were left shrivelled by a bout with polio at age seven. He has campaigned with UNICEF to eradicate polio. [54]

cell.html: An actor, broadcaster, and writer and performer of comic songs , often in partnership with Donald Swann . He contracted polio in 1943 while serving in the Royal Navy , and required a wheelchair for the rest of his life. [55]
cell.text: An actor, broadcaster, and writer and performer of comic songs , often in partnership with Donald Swann . He contracted polio in 1943 while serving in the Royal Navy , and required a wheelchair for the rest of his life. [55]

cell.html: Later a cellist , as a child, Fournier began playing the piano. In 1915 he had a mild case of polio, and lost dexterity in his legs and feet. No longer able to master the use of the piano pedals he turned to playing the cello . [56]
cell.text: Later a cellist , as a child, Fournier began playing the piano. In 1915 he had a mild case of polio, and lost dexterity in his legs and feet. No longer able to master the use of the piano pedals he turned to playing the cello . [56]

cell.html: Haden, a renowned jazz double bassist , began singing in his family's band as a toddler. After a bout with polio at age 15 paralysed his vocal cords and throat, he took up the bass guitar . [57] [58]
cell.text: Haden, a renowned jazz double bassist , began singing in his family's band as a toddler. After a bout with polio at age 15 paralysed his vocal cords and throat, he took up the bass guitar . [57] [58]

cell.html: This reggae band was formed after the three founding members met at the Mona Rehabilitation Centre in Kingston, Jamaica in the 1950's. [56] Member Albert "Apple Gabriel" Craig said of his bout with polio, "It take a lot from me outta life, but at the same time it give me much more in life". [59]
cell.text: This reggae band was formed after the three founding members met at the Mona Rehabilitation Centre in Kingston, Jamaica in the 1950's. [56] Member Albert "Apple Gabriel" Craig said of his bout with polio, "It take a lot from me outta life, but at the same time it give me much more in life". [59]

cell.html: Trombonist Waldren "Frog" Joseph had polio as an infant, which left him with a permanent limp. He began playing music during his recovery. [60]
cell.text: Trombonist Waldren "Frog" Joseph had polio as an infant, which left him with a permanent limp. He began playing music during his recovery. [60]

cell.html: A soprano whose battle with polio and, subsequently, depression at the height of her career, is the subject of the 1955 film Interrupted Melody . [61]
cell.text: A soprano whose battle with polio and, subsequently, depression at the height of her career, is the subject of the 1955 film Interrupted Melody . [61]

cell.html: Marshall, a soprano , caught polio, aged two, and required many operations over ten years to help fix her legs. [62]
cell.text: Marshall, a soprano , caught polio, aged two, and required many operations over ten years to help fix her legs. [62]

cell.html: A folk - blues singer and guitarist, best known for his collaborations with harmonica player Sonny Terry . When McGee was paralysed due to polio as a child, he constructed a pushcart to get around. The cart was propelled with a stick by his younger brother, Granville "Stick" McGhee . [63]
cell.text: A folk - blues singer and guitarist, best known for his collaborations with harmonica player Sonny Terry . When McGee was paralysed due to polio as a child, he constructed a pushcart to get around. The cart was propelled with a stick by his younger brother, Granville "Stick" McGhee . [63]

cell.html: A musician, songwriter and painter. Mitchell started singing at age nine while in hospital recovering from polio. [64]
cell.text: A musician, songwriter and painter. Mitchell started singing at age nine while in hospital recovering from polio. [64]

cell.html: A jazz pianist . He caught polio as a child, which paralysed the fourth and fifth fingers on his right hand. [65]
cell.text: A jazz pianist . He caught polio as a child, which paralysed the fourth and fifth fingers on his right hand. [65]

cell.html: A virtuoso violinist . He caught polio, aged four. Perlman requires braces and crutches to walk, and plays the violin sitting down. [66]
cell.text: A virtuoso violinist . He caught polio, aged four. Perlman requires braces and crutches to walk, and plays the violin sitting down. [66]

cell.html: Best known for his hit pop music song Tell Laura I Love Her , Peterson started singing while hospitalised with polio. [67]
cell.text: Best known for his hit pop music song Tell Laura I Love Her , Peterson started singing while hospitalised with polio. [67]

cell.html: A blues singer and songwriter. He caught polio as a child, which left him in braces and using crutches. Later, a fall down stairs left him in a wheelchair for the rest of his life. [68] [69]
cell.text: A blues singer and songwriter. He caught polio as a child, which left him in braces and using crutches. Later, a fall down stairs left him in a wheelchair for the rest of his life. [68] [69]

cell.html: A jazz saxophonist . He caught polio, aged three, and had to spend one year in an iron lung, followed by two years in bed. He was advised to learn a wind instrument to help with his recovery. Sanborn is now affected by post-polio syndrome . [70]
cell.text: A jazz saxophonist . He caught polio, aged three, and had to spend one year in an iron lung, followed by two years in bed. He was advised to learn a wind instrument to help with his recovery. Sanborn is now affected by post-polio syndrome . [70]

cell.html: A big band singer, actress and talk show host. Shore caught polio, aged 18 months, which left her right leg crippled. She recovered strength through massage, swimming and tennis. [71]
cell.text: A big band singer, actress and talk show host. Shore caught polio, aged 18 months, which left her right leg crippled. She recovered strength through massage, swimming and tennis. [71]

cell.html: A cabaret and jazz singer, Syms had polio as a child. [72]
cell.text: A cabaret and jazz singer, Syms had polio as a child. [72]

cell.html: Tebaldi, a soprano, contracted polio at age three, which caused her difficulty walking. During this experience she discovered music, which she said saved her life. [73]
cell.text: Tebaldi, a soprano, contracted polio at age three, which caused her difficulty walking. During this experience she discovered music, which she said saved her life. [73]

cell.html: A singer-songwriter and guitarist. He caught polio, aged five, during the epidemic of 1951. [74]
cell.text: A singer-songwriter and guitarist. He caught polio, aged five, during the epidemic of 1951. [74]

context.text: List of poliomyelitis survivors - Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
Name Life Comments
Singer-songwriter Neil Young caught polio during an epidemic in the summer of 1951.
List of poliomyelitis survivors
Cecil 'Skelly' Spence of Israel Vibration , a band founded by three polio survivors.
[ edit ] Politics
[ edit ] Uncontested diagnosis
[ edit ] Retrospective diagnosis
[ edit ] Doubtful diagnosis
[ edit ] Mistakenly believed to have survived polio
[ edit ] Notes and references
Contents
Saxophonist David Sanborn spent a year in an iron lung .
[ edit ] Music
Kim Beazley was hospitalised with polio as a child.
Television presenter David Onley found his employers to be supportive in accommodating his extra needs.
Director Francis Ford Coppola 's childhood was interrupted by polio for over a year.

This is an incomplete list , which may never be able to satisfy certain standards for completeness. Revisions and sourced additions are welcome. Itzhak Perlman , a polio survivor, plays the violin sitting down.
[ edit ] Film, television and radio
Former senator John Porter East contracted polio in 1955 while serving as a lieutenant in the United States Marines.
Judith Heumann had to take legal action to be allowed to become a teacher.
[ edit ] Disability rights activists
Robert McNamara 's career was changed when both he and his wife caught polio.
Toymaker Margarete Steiff was paralysed as an infant.

entity.htmlSnippet:
NameLifeComments
Carey Blyton1932–2002A composer and writer best known for his song Bananas In Pyjamas. Blyton contracted polio in 1947 and learned to play the piano during his two-year convalescence to “demonstrate that the illness wouldn't get the better of him.”[48]
Connee Boswell1907–1976A jazz singer who performed with her sisters as "The Boswell Sisters". She caught polio, aged three, and was left with partially paralysed legs. Boswell used a wheelchair for most of her life.[49]
Judy Collinsborn 1939As a child, singer-songwriter Judy Collins spent several months in hospital recovering from bout with polio. Collins later became a representative for UNICEF and has worked to promote polio vaccination programmes.[50]
CeDell Davisborn 1927A blues guitarist and singer. After a bout with polio at age nine crippled his hands Davis learned to play the guitar upside down, using a butter knife to help fret the strings, producing a similar sound to a slide guitar.[51]
James DePreistborn 1936Conductor James DePreist contracted polio in 1962 while on tour in Bangkok. Instead of using crutches and braces he conducts sitting down.[52]
Donovanborn 1946Folk singer-songwriter and guitarist Donovan contracted polio, aged four, from the vaccine he was given. This left him with a limp and feeling excluded. However, he says "I kind of look back on it and think it was positive for me because it made me withdraw from my pals and realise I was different."[53]
Ian Dury1942–2000A rock and roll singer and songwriter, leader of the band "Ian Dury and the Blockheads". His hand and leg were left shrivelled by a bout with polio at age seven. He has campaigned with UNICEF to eradicate polio.[54]
Michael Flanders1922–1975An actor, broadcaster, and writer and performer of comic songs, often in partnership with Donald Swann. He contracted polio in 1943 while serving in the Royal Navy, and required a wheelchair for the rest of his life.[55]
Pierre Fournier1906–1986Later a cellist, as a child, Fournier began playing the piano. In 1915 he had a mild case of polio, and lost dexterity in his legs and feet. No longer able to master the use of the piano pedals he turned to playing the cello.[56]
Charlie Hadenborn 1937Haden, a renowned jazz double bassist, began singing in his family's band as a toddler. After a bout with polio at age 15 paralysed his vocal cords and throat, he took up the bass guitar.[57][58]
Israel VibrationThis reggae band was formed after the three founding members met at the Mona Rehabilitation Centre in Kingston, Jamaica in the 1950's.[56] Member Albert "Apple Gabriel" Craig said of his bout with polio, "It take a lot from me outta life, but at the same time it give me much more in life".[59]
Waldren Joseph1918–2004Trombonist Waldren "Frog" Joseph had polio as an infant, which left him with a permanent limp. He began playing music during his recovery.[60]
Marjorie Lawrence1909–1979A soprano whose battle with polio and, subsequently, depression at the height of her career, is the subject of the 1955 film Interrupted Melody.[61]
Lois Marshall1924–1997Marshall, a soprano, caught polio, aged two, and required many operations over ten years to help fix her legs.[62]
Brownie McGhee1915–1996A folk-blues singer and guitarist, best known for his collaborations with harmonica player Sonny Terry. When McGee was paralysed due to polio as a child, he constructed a pushcart to get around. The cart was propelled with a stick by his younger brother, Granville "Stick" McGhee.[63]
Joni Mitchellborn 1943A musician, songwriter and painter. Mitchell started singing at age nine while in hospital recovering from polio.[64]
Horace Parlanborn 1931A jazz pianist. He caught polio as a child, which paralysed the fourth and fifth fingers on his right hand.[65]
Itzhak Perlmanborn 1945A virtuoso violinist. He caught polio, aged four. Perlman requires braces and crutches to walk, and plays the violin sitting down.[66]
Ray Peterson1939–2005Best known for his hit pop music song Tell Laura I Love Her, Peterson started singing while hospitalised with polio.[67]
Doc Pomus1925–1991A blues singer and songwriter. He caught polio as a child, which left him in braces and using crutches. Later, a fall down stairs left him in a wheelchair for the rest of his life.[68][69]
David Sanbornborn 1945A jazz saxophonist. He caught polio, aged three, and had to spend one year in an iron lung, followed by two years in bed. He was advised to learn a wind instrument to help with his recovery. Sanborn is now affected by post-polio syndrome.[70]
Dinah Shore1916–1994A big band singer, actress and talk show host. Shore caught polio, aged 18 months, which left her right leg crippled. She recovered strength through massage, swimming and tennis.[71]
Sylvia Syms1917–1992A cabaret and jazz singer, Syms had polio as a child.[72]
Renata Tebaldi1922–2004Tebaldi, a soprano, contracted polio at age three, which caused her difficulty walking. During this experience she discovered music, which she said saved her life.[73]
Neil Youngborn 1945A singer-songwriter and guitarist. He caught polio, aged five, during the epidemic of 1951.[74]
